comment.author: 43854658@N00
comment._content: This appears to be one of several débutante announcement photographs of Margaret Resler Warren of New York City, who was introduced to Society on December 9, 1913, with a reception, dinner and dance. A daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Charles Elliott Warren, Margaret was a descendant of General Warren of Bunker Hill. She was a graduate of The Spence School. Her father was President of the Lincoln National Bank. [1] [2] A different photograph of Miss Warren, by Campbell Studios, appeared in the October 19, 1913, New York Times, however the accompanying article seems to have been, perhaps, cut of débutante announcements. A variant of the pose used in the Times is in the Bain Collection (shown below) of The Library of Congress, and will no doubt find its way to Flickr ;)                                     On January 22, 1921, Margaret Warren married Shannon Lord Meany (b.1892), the son of Mr. and Mrs. Edward P. Meany (b.1854) of Alnwick Hall, Convent, New Jersey. He was a graduate of Princeton and served as a Captain during the war. Their engagement was announced in October, 1920. [3] [4] [5] [6] Margaret and Shannon Meany separated in 1939, and she was awarded a divorce in Reno in 1940. [7] [8]
